column4: How about this "unknown error executW: GPG error: http://security.ubuntu.com feisty-security Release: Unknown error executing gpgv
and doing sudo apt-get remove ethereal followed by sudo apt-get install ethereal didn't resolve it either
Yeah, ethereal needs a lot of stuff.
it seems instead of installing ethereal, it installed wireshark.
I strongly disapprove. That's the distro not only telling me that it knows better than me what software it wants me to run...but it doesn't even INFORM me of that fact.
that's kind of like microsoft distributing a "dummy firefox installer" that actually installs IE
The web site with source was there two hours ago :P
they changed names a while back
However, my point is, I should get something like "This product is obsolete and no longer included with Ubuntu. You may want to consider Wireshark instead."
yes wireshark=ethereal with a new name pretty much and better coding :)
